definition.en: Used to refer to specific or particular nouns.
definition.ar: تستخدم للإشارة إلى أسماء محددة أو معينة.

words.usage_notes: The most common word in English, used as a definite article.

examples.en: {The} cat is sleeping on the sofa.

examples.ar: هذا هو أفضل يوم على الإطلاق.

questions.explanation: The definite article "the" translates to the prefix "الـ" in Arabic.
"the" is the English equivalent of the Arabic definite article.
Use "the" for unique celestial bodies.
Use "the" for specific objects.
Use "the" before "end".
Refers to a specific book.
Use "the" for the planet Earth.
Refers to a specific park.

definition.en: To exist or live; used to describe states.
definition.ar: أن يوجد أو يعيش؛ يستخدم لوصف الحالات.

words.usage_notes: The most irregular verb in English.

questions.explanation: "be" is the base form of the verb to exist.
The Arabic verb "يكون" corresponds to "be".
Use "am" with the pronoun "I".
Use "is" with third-person singular.
Use "are" with plural subjects.
Use "was" for past tense singular.

questions.full_sentence: We were late for the meeting.
questions.explanation: Use "were" for past tense plural.
Use "been" as the past participle.

definition.en: Expressing motion in the direction of a particular location.
definition.ar: التعبير عن الحركة في اتجاه موقع معين.

words.usage_notes: Used both as a preposition and as part of an infinitive verb.

questions.explanation: "to" is a preposition indicating direction.
The Arabic "إلى" translates to "to" in English.
Use "to" to indicate direction.
Use "to" before the base form of a verb (infinitive).
The verb "listen" is followed by "to".
Use "to" to indicate the recipient.
Use "to" with "back" to indicate returning.
Common phrase using "to".

definition.en: Expressing the relationship between a part and a whole.
definition.ar: التعبير عن العلاقة بين الجزء والكل.

words.usage_notes: Often used to show possession or belonging.

questions.explanation: "of" often translates to "من" when indicating parts of a whole.
The Arabic "من" can translate to "of" in many contexts.
Use "of" to connect a container and its contents.
Use "of" to show titles or belonging.
Use "of" to show a part of a whole.
Common phrasal usage.
The phrase "because of" indicates reason.
The phrase "instead of" indicates substitution.

definition.en: Used to connect words, clauses, or sentences.
definition.ar: تستخدم لربط الكلمات أو العبارات أو الجمل.

words.usage_notes: The primary conjunction for joining items in a list.

questions.explanation: "and" is the English conjunction for "و".
The Arabic letter "و" translates to "and".
Use "and" to join two food items.
Use "and" to join pronouns.
Use "and" to join colors.
Use "and" to join opposites.
Use "and" to join two verbs.
Use "and" to join nouns.

definition.en: Used before a singular noun that is not specific.
definition.ar: تستخدم قبل الاسم المفرد غير المحدد.

words.usage_notes: Used before words starting with a consonant sound.

questions.explanation: "a" is the indefinite article used before consonant sounds.
The English indefinite article is "a".
Use "a" before a singular noun starting with a consonant.
Use "a" for a non-specific singular noun.
Use "a" to identify a singular object.
Use "a" before an adjective-noun phrase.
Note: "an" is used before vowel sounds (distractor check).
Common expression using "a".

definition.en: Expressing the situation of something that is or appears to be enclosed or surrounded by something else.
definition.ar: التعبير عن حالة شيء موجود داخل أو محاط بشيء آخر.

words.usage_notes: Used for locations, months, and years.

questions.explanation: "in" is the primary preposition for "في".
The Arabic "في" translates to "in" in English.

questions.full_sentence: The milk is in the fridge.
questions.explanation: Use "in" for items inside a container.
Use "in" for being inside a vehicle.

questions.full_sentence: I will see you in June.
questions.explanation: Use "in" before months.
Use "in" for locations.

questions.full_sentence: The book is in my hand.
questions.explanation: Use "in" for things held within something.
Use "in" for living in a place.

definition.en: Used to identify a specific person or thing observed by the speaker.
definition.ar: يستخدم لتحديد شخص أو شيء معين يلاحظه المتحدث.

words.usage_notes: Can be a demonstrative pronoun or a conjunction.

questions.explanation: "that" is used for singular objects at a distance.
The Arabic "ذلك" translates to "that".
Use "That" to point to a singular object.

questions.full_sentence: I think that it will rain.
questions.explanation: Use "that" as a conjunction to connect clauses.
Use "that" to refer to a specific person.
Use "that" to specify a choice.

questions.full_sentence: She said that she was happy.
questions.explanation: Use "that" to report what someone said.
Use "That" to refer to a past event or object.

definition.en: To possess, own, or hold.
definition.ar: أن يمتلك، يملك، أو يحوز.

words.usage_notes: Also used as an auxiliary verb in perfect tenses.

questions.explanation: "have" is the base form for possession.
The Arabic "يملك" translates to "have".
Use "have" with the pronoun "I".
Use "has" for third-person singular.
Use "had" for past tense.
Use "have" for plural subjects.
Use "has" as an auxiliary verb for "he".
Use "having" for continuous actions.

definition.en: Used by a speaker to refer to himself or herself.
definition.ar: يستخدمه المتحدث للإشارة إلى نفسه.

words.usage_notes: Always capitalized in English.

questions.explanation: "I" is the first-person singular subject pronoun.
The Arabic "أنا" translates to "I".
Use "I" as the subject before "am".
Use "me" as the object of the verb.
Use "My" to show possession.
Use "mine" as a possessive pronoun.

questions.full_sentence: I saw myself in the mirror.
questions.explanation: Use "myself" when the subject and object are the same.
Use "I" as the subject pronoun.

definition.en: Used to refer to a thing previously mentioned or easily identified.
definition.ar: يستخدم للإشارة إلى شيء ذكر سابقاً أو يمكن التعرف عليه بسهولة.

words.usage_notes: Used for animals, objects, and abstract ideas.

examples.en: I like this book, I read {it} every day.
examples.ar: أحب هذا الكتاب، أقرأه كل يوم.

questions.explanation: "it" is the neutral pronoun for objects and animals.
The English pronoun for non-human subjects is "it".
Use "It" as a dummy subject for weather.

prompt.text: I saw the movie and liked ___.

questions.sentence_with_blank: I saw the movie and liked ___.
questions.full_sentence: I saw the movie and liked it.
questions.explanation: Use "it" as an object referring to the movie.
Use "its" for possession by an animal.
Use "itself" when the object is the same as the subject.

prompt.text: Where is my pen? I cannot find ___.

questions.sentence_with_blank: Where is my pen? I cannot find ___.
questions.full_sentence: Where is my pen? I cannot find it.
questions.explanation: Use "it" to refer to the pen.
Use "It" to talk about time.

definition.en: Used to indicate the person or thing that something is intended for.
definition.ar: يستخدم للإشارة إلى الشخص أو الشيء الذي خصص له شيء ما.

words.usage_notes: Can indicate purpose, destination, or duration.

examples.en: I have lived here {for} two years.

questions.explanation: "for" is a preposition often meaning "لأجل" or "لمدة".
The Arabic "لأجل" translates to "for" in English.
Use "for" to indicate the recipient.
The verb "wait" is followed by "for".
Use "for" to indicate duration of time.

questions.full_sentence: Is there a cure for this.
questions.explanation: Use "for" to indicate purpose or target.

questions.full_sentence: He works for a big company.
questions.explanation: Use "for" to indicate an employer.
Use "for" to indicate benefit.

definition.en: Used with an auxiliary verb or "be" to form the negative.
definition.ar: يستخدم مع فعل مساعد أو فعل الكينونة لتكوين النفي.

words.usage_notes: Usually placed after the first auxiliary verb.

questions.explanation: "not" is the primary word used for negation.
The Arabic negation "ليس" or "لا" translates to "not".
Use "not" after "am" to negate the sentence.

questions.full_sentence: Do not run in the hall.
questions.explanation: Use "not" with "do" for negative commands.

questions.full_sentence: He does not have a car.
questions.explanation: Use "not" after "does" for third-person negation.
Use "not" after "is" to negate possession.
Use "not" after "are" for plural negation.
Use "not" after "was" for past negation.

definition.en: Physically in contact with and supported by a surface.
definition.ar: ملامس جسدياً لسطح ما ومدعوم به.

words.usage_notes: Used for surfaces, days of the week, and electronic devices.

questions.explanation: "on" is the primary preposition for surfaces.
The Arabic "على" translates to "on" in English.

questions.full_sentence: Put the cup on the desk.
questions.explanation: Use "on" for objects on a surface.
Use "on" before days of the week.

prompt.text: The cat is sitting ___ the floor.

questions.sentence_with_blank: The cat is sitting ___ the floor.
questions.full_sentence: The cat is sitting on the floor.
questions.explanation: Use "on" for the floor.
Use "on" to indicate a device is working.
Use "on" for street names in many contexts.

prompt.text: There is a fly ___ the ceiling.

questions.sentence_with_blank: There is a fly ___ the ceiling.
questions.full_sentence: There is a fly on the ceiling.
questions.explanation: Use "on" for contact with a surface, even overhead.

definition.en: Accompanied by another person or thing.
definition.ar: برفقة شخص أو شيء آخر.

words.usage_notes: Used to indicate accompaniment, instrument, or manner.

questions.explanation: "with" is the primary preposition for accompaniment.
The Arabic "مع" translates to "with" in English.
Use "with" to show accompaniment.

questions.full_sentence: Cut the bread with a knife.
questions.explanation: Use "with" to indicate the tool used.
Use "with" to ask about agreement or presence.
Use "with" after certain adjectives like "angry".
Use "with" for ingredients or additions.
Use "with" for walking together.

definition.en: Used to refer to a man, boy, or male animal previously mentioned.
definition.ar: يستخدم للإشارة إلى رجل أو ولد أو حيوان ذكر ذكر سابقاً.

words.usage_notes: The third-person singular masculine subject pronoun.

questions.explanation: "he" is the masculine subject pronoun.
The Arabic "هو" translates to "he" in English.
Use "He" as the subject for a male person.
Use "him" as the object pronoun.
Use "His" to show possession for a male.
Use "himself" to mean alone or without help.
Use "his" as a possessive pronoun at the end of a sentence.
Use "He" as the subject pronoun.

definition.en: Used to indicate that something happens during the time when something else is taking place.
definition.ar: يستخدم للإشارة إلى أن شيئاً ما يحدث في الوقت الذي يحدث فيه شيء آخر.

words.usage_notes: Can be used for comparison, time, or role.

examples.en: {As} it was raining, we stayed home.
examples.ar: بما أنها كانت تمطر، بقينا في المنزل.

examples.en: I saw him {as} I was leaving.
It is not {as} easy {as} it looks.

questions.explanation: "as" is used to describe roles or comparisons.
The Arabic "كـ" or "كما" often translates to "as".
Use "as" to indicate a job or role.

prompt.text: He is as strong ___ an ox.

questions.sentence_with_blank: He is as strong ___ an ox.
questions.full_sentence: He is as strong as an ox.
questions.explanation: Use "as...as" for comparisons.

prompt.text: ___ I mentioned before, it is free.

questions.sentence_with_blank: ___ I mentioned before, it is free.
questions.full_sentence: As I mentioned before, it is free.
questions.explanation: Use "As" to refer back to a previous statement.

questions.full_sentence: I arrived just as he left.
questions.explanation: Use "as" to indicate simultaneous actions.

prompt.text: ___ you know, today is a holiday.

questions.sentence_with_blank: ___ you know, today is a holiday.
questions.full_sentence: As you know, today is a holiday.
questions.explanation: Use "As" to introduce a known fact.

prompt.text: It is not so big ___ that one.

questions.sentence_with_blank: It is not so big ___ that one.
questions.full_sentence: It is not so big as that one.
questions.explanation: Use "as" in negative comparisons.

definition.en: Used to refer to the person or people that the speaker is addressing.
definition.ar: يستخدم للإشارة إلى الشخص أو الأشخاص الذين يخاطبهم المتحدث.

words.usage_notes: Used for both singular and plural second person.

questions.explanation: "you" is the second-person pronoun.
The Arabic "أنت" translates to "you" in English.
Use "You" as the subject pronoun.

questions.full_sentence: I can help you with that.
questions.explanation: Use "you" as the object pronoun.
Use "your" to show possession.
Use "yours" as a possessive pronoun at the end of a sentence.
Use "yourself" as the reflexive pronoun for singular "you".
Use "You" for plural address as well.

definition.en: To perform an action, activity, or task.
definition.ar: للقيام بعمل أو نشاط أو مهمة.

words.usage_notes: Used as both a main verb and an auxiliary verb for questions and negatives.

questions.explanation: "do" is the base form of the verb to perform an action.
The Arabic "يفعل" translates to "do" in English.
Use "do" with the pronoun "I".

questions.full_sentence: He does his laundry on Sundays.
questions.explanation: Use "does" for third-person singular present.
Use "did" for the past tense.
Use "done" as the past participle after "have".
Use "doing" for continuous actions.
Use "Do" to start a question in the present tense.

definition.en: To receive, obtain, or reach a state.
definition.ar: أن يتلقى، يحصل على، أو يصل إلى حالة معينة.

words.usage_notes: A very versatile verb used in many phrasal verbs.

examples.ar: هي تتلقى الكثير من رسائل البريد الإلكتروني.

examples.en: He {got} a new car last week.
examples.ar: حصل على سيارة جديدة الأسبوع الماضي.

questions.explanation: "get" commonly means to obtain or receive.
The Arabic "يحصل على" translates to "get".

questions.full_sentence: I usually get up at 7 AM.
questions.explanation: Use the base form for habitual actions.
Use "gets" for third-person singular present.

questions.full_sentence: We got lost in the city.
questions.explanation: Use "got" for past tense.
Use "getting" for a changing state.

prompt.text: I have ___ a gift for you.

questions.sentence_with_blank: I have ___ a gift for you.
questions.full_sentence: I have gotten a gift for you.
questions.explanation: Use "gotten" as the past participle.
Use base form after "did".

definition.en: To utter words so as to convey information, an opinion, or a feeling.
definition.ar: نطق الكلمات لنقل معلومات أو رأي أو شعور.

words.usage_notes: Used for direct and indirect speech.

questions.explanation: "say" is the base verb for expressing words.
The Arabic verb "يقول" translates to "say".

questions.full_sentence: Please say hello to your father.
questions.explanation: Use the base form "say" for imperatives.
Use "says" for third-person singular present.

questions.full_sentence: Yesterday, she said she was tired.
questions.explanation: Use "said" for the past tense.
Use "saying" for the present continuous.
Use "said" as the past participle.

prompt.text: They ___ that the movie is good.

questions.sentence_with_blank: They ___ that the movie is good.
questions.full_sentence: They say that the movie is good.
questions.explanation: Use "say" for plural subjects.

definition.en: Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to a female person.
definition.ar: تستخدم كمفعول به لفعل أو حرف جر للإشارة إلى أنثى.

words.usage_notes: Can be an object pronoun or a possessive determiner.

questions.explanation: "her" refers to a female as an object or possessor.
The Arabic suffix "ـها" or "لها" translates to "her".
Use "her" as the object pronoun for a female.
Use "Her" as a possessive determiner.
Use "her" as the object of the verb "call".
Use "her" to show possession.

questions.full_sentence: I bought a gift for her.
questions.explanation: Use "her" after the preposition "for".
Use "Her" to describe a feature belonging to her.

definition.en: Used to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal previously mentioned.
definition.ar: تستخدم للإشارة إلى امرأة أو فتاة أو حيوان أنثى ذكر سابقاً.

words.usage_notes: The third-person singular feminine subject pronoun.

questions.explanation: "she" is the feminine subject pronoun.
The Arabic "هي" translates to "she" in English.
Use "She" as the subject for a female person.
Use "she" as the subject in a question.
Use "She" as the subject pronoun.
Use "She" to refer to a female friend.
Use "she" as the subject pronoun.
Use "She" as the subject pronoun.

definition.en: Used to link alternatives.
definition.ar: تستخدم للربط بين البدائل.

words.usage_notes: Used in questions and negative statements to offer choices.

questions.explanation: "or" is used to present a choice between two things.
The Arabic "أو" translates to "or" in English.

questions.full_sentence: Do you want milk or sugar?
questions.explanation: Use "or" to offer a choice.

prompt.text: Is he a doctor ___ a nurse?

questions.sentence_with_blank: Is he a doctor ___ a nurse?
questions.full_sentence: Is he a doctor or a nurse?
questions.explanation: Use "or" to ask about alternatives.
Common binary choice using "or".

prompt.text: Stop ___ I will call the police.

questions.sentence_with_blank: Stop ___ I will call the police.
questions.full_sentence: Stop or I will call the police.
questions.explanation: Use "or" to show a consequence of not doing something.
Use "or" for choices between days.

prompt.text: Eat it now ___ it will get cold.

questions.sentence_with_blank: Eat it now ___ it will get cold.
questions.full_sentence: Eat it now or it will get cold.
questions.explanation: Use "or" to link a condition and a result.

definition.en: Used before a singular noun starting with a vowel sound.
definition.ar: تستخدم قبل الاسم المفرد الذي يبدأ بصوت متحرك.

words.usage_notes: Used before vowel sounds (a, e, i, o, u) and silent "h".

questions.explanation: "an" is the indefinite article used before vowel sounds.
The English indefinite article for vowel sounds is "an".
Use "an" before a word starting with a vowel sound.
Use "an" before "engineer" because it starts with "e".
Use "an" before "hour" because the "h" is silent.
Use "an" before the adjective "easy".
Use "an" before "idea".
Use "an" before "old".

definition.en: Used to express future tense, intent, or prediction.
definition.ar: يستخدم للتعبير عن صيغة المستقبل أو النية أو التنبؤ.

words.usage_notes: As a modal verb, it does not change for person (I will, he will).

examples.en: She {will} be happy to see you.

questions.explanation: "will" is the primary modal verb for the future tense.
The Arabic "سوف" or the prefix "سـ" translates to "will".
Use "will" to indicate a future action.
Use "will" with "not" for future negation.
Use "Will" to start a request or future question.

questions.full_sentence: It will be a long journey.
questions.explanation: Use "will" for predictions.
Use "will" to express a promise or intent.
Use "will" for future states.

definition.en: Belonging to or associated with the speaker.
definition.ar: ينتمي إلى المتحدث أو مرتبط به.

words.usage_notes: Used as a possessive determiner before a noun.

questions.explanation: "my" is the possessive form for the speaker.
The Arabic suffix "ـي" translates to "my" in English.
Use "My" to show that the car belongs to you.
Use "my" before the noun "job".
Use "my" to introduce someone you know.
Use "My" for parts of your body.

questions.full_sentence: I need to wash my hands.
questions.explanation: Use "my" to show possession of hands.
Use "My" to express your preference.

definition.en: The lowest cardinal number; a single person or thing.
definition.ar: أقل عدد أصلي؛ شخص واحد أو شيء واحد.

words.usage_notes: Can be used as a number or a pronoun to avoid repeating a noun.

questions.explanation: "one" is the number 1.
The Arabic "واحد" translates to "one".
Use "one" to indicate the quantity of 1.

questions.full_sentence: One of my friends is here.
questions.explanation: Use "One" to refer to a single member of a group.
Use "one" as a pronoun to replace a noun.
Basic math using the number "one".

questions.full_sentence: He is the one for me.
questions.explanation: Use "one" to mean the specific person.
Use "one" to ask about a specific choice.

definition.en: The whole quantity or amount of something.
definition.ar: الكمية أو المقدار الكامل لشيء ما.

words.usage_notes: Can be used as a determiner, pronoun, or adverb.

questions.explanation: "all" refers to the entire group or amount.
The Arabic "كل" translates to "all" in English.
Use "All" to refer to the whole group of friends.
Use "all" to indicate the total amount of money.
Use "all" to mean "everything".
Use "all" after a pronoun for emphasis.
Common phrase meaning the entire day.
Idiomatic expression meaning "suddenly".

definition.en: Used to indicate a consequence, a polite request, or a past habit.
definition.ar: يستخدم للإشارة إلى نتيجة، أو طلب مهذب، أو عادة في الماضي.

words.usage_notes: Often used in conditional sentences and for politeness.

questions.explanation: "would" is used for polite requests and conditionals.
The Arabic "ودّ" or "سـ" (in past context) translates to "would".
Use "Would" to make a polite offer.

questions.full_sentence: I would love to visit Paris.
questions.explanation: Use "would" to express a strong desire.

prompt.text: If I were you, I ___ go.

questions.sentence_with_blank: If I were you, I ___ go.
questions.full_sentence: If I were you, I would go.
questions.explanation: Use "would" in the second conditional.
Use "Would" for polite requests.
Use "would" for refusal in the past or conditional.
Use "would" as the past tense of "will".
